Code Documentation

skfibers.fibers module

class skfibers.fibers.FIBERS(label_name='Class', duration_name='Duration', given_starting_point=False, amino_acid_start_point=None, amino_acid_bins_start_point=None, iterations=1000, set_number_of_bins=50, min_features_per_group=2, max_number_of_groups_with_feature=4, informative_cutoff=0.2, crossover_probability=0.5, mutation_probability=0.4, elitism_parameter=0.8, random_seed=None)[source]

Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

A Scikit-Learn compatible framework for the FIBERS Algorithm.

Parameters:

  • label_name – label for the class/endpoint column in the dataset (e.g., ‘Class’)

  • duration_name – label to omit extra column in the dataset

  • given_starting_point – whether or not expert knowledge is being inputted (True or False)

  • amino_acid_start_point – if RARE is starting with expert knowledge, input the list of features here; otherwise None

  • amino_acid_bins_start_point – if RARE is starting with expert knowledge, input the list of bins of features here; otherwise None

  • iterations – the number of evolutionary cycles RARE will run

  • set_number_of_bins – the population size of candidate bins

  • min_features_per_group – the minimum number of features in a bin

  • max_number_of_groups_with_feature – the maximum number of bins containing a feature

  • crossover_probability – the probability of each feature in an offspring bin to crossover to the paired offspring bin (recommendation: 0.5 to 0.8)

  • mutation_probability – the probability of each feature in a bin to be deleted (a proportionate probability is automatically applied on each feature outside the bin to be added (recommendation: 0.05 to 0.5 depending on situation and number of iterations run)

  • elitism_parameter – the proportion of elite bins in the current generation to be preserved for the next evolutionary cycle (recommendation: 0.2 to 0.8 depending on conservativeness of approach and number of iterations run)

  • random_seed – the seed value needed to generate a random number

fibers_fit(original_feature_matrix)[source]

Scikit-learn required function for Supervised training of FIBERS

Parameters:

original_feature_matrix – array-like {n_samples, n_features} Training instances. ALL INSTANCE ATTRIBUTES MUST BE NUMERIC or NAN

Returns:

self, bin_feature_matrix_internal, amino_acid_bins_internal, amino_acid_bin_scores_internal, maf_0_features

fit(x, y=None)[source]

Scikit-learn required function for Supervised training of FIBERS

Parameters:

  • x – array-like {n_samples, n_features} Training instances. ALL INSTANCE ATTRIBUTES MUST BE NUMERIC or NAN OR array-like dataframe {n_samples, n_features} Training instances with column name as given in label_name and duration_name. ALL INSTANCE ATTRIBUTES MUST BE NUMERIC or NAN when y=None

  • y – None or list of list/tuples with (censoring, duration) {n_samples, 2} labels. ALL INSTANCE PHENOTYPES MUST BE NUMERIC NOT NAN OR OTHER TYPE

Returns:

self

get_bin_scores(save=None)[source]

Function to get all bins and their corresponding log-rank scores

Parameters:

save – filename to save bins to or None to skip (default=None)

Returns:

pd.DataFrame of Bins and their corresponding log-rank scores.

get_bin_summary(prin=False, save=None, bin_order=0)[source]

Function to print statistics summary of given bin

Parameters:

  • prin – flag to print statistics summary

  • save – filename to save statistics to or None to skip (default=None)

  • bin_order – bin index in sorted bins by log rank score (starts from 0, default=0)

Returns:

log_rank_results, summary_dataframe

get_bin_survival_plot(show=False, save=None, bin_order=0)[source]

Function to plot Kaplan Meier Survival Plot

Parameters:

  • show – flag to show plot

  • save – filename to save plot to or None to skip (default=None)

  • bin_order – bin_order: bin index in sorted bins by log rank score (starts from 0, default=0)

Returns:

None
